{"step_by_step_thinking": "Document [0] states that it appears safe to administer intensive chemotherapy regimens at standard doses to rural patients without increased morbidity or mortality. Document [1] also supports this by stating that it appears safe to administer chemotherapy in rural towns under the supervision of medical oncologists from larger centres via teleoncology, provided that rural health care resources and governance arrangements are adequate. Document [2] also supports the safety of administering chemotherapy in smaller rural towns under supervision by health professionals from larger centers using telehealth.", "answer_choice": "A"}
